title: v2 has no success criteria — only a phase map
issue: v2 removes the explicit success criteria section present in v1 and replaces it with a Phase Map that shows status but not completion gates. There is no document-level success gate answering: 'How do we know v2 requirements are correctly implemented?'
required_context: Requires knowing that v1 had an explicit top-level success criteria section. The v2 document has per-FR acceptance criteria throughout but no consolidated gate; a reviewer without v1 context cannot identify this as a regression. Also contains the word 'removes' which is only meaningful with v1 knowledge.

title: Problem statement unchanged despite root cause being wrong in v1
issue: The v2 problem statement is verbatim from v1: 'no systematic way to measure effectiveness.' But v1 failed not because measurement was absent — it failed because the measurement architecture assumed skills were single-turn reviewers when they are orchestration workflows.
required_context: Requires knowing that v1 eval framework failed and what its root cause was. Not inferable from the v2 document alone.

title: v1 detection thresholds (90%/80%) not confirmed or superseded in v2
issue: v1 established 90% recall and 80% precision as targets. v2 references these only in an example but never restates, adjusts, or explicitly deprecates them. It is unclear whether these thresholds apply to v2.
required_context: Requires knowing that v1 had explicit 90%/80% thresholds. The v2 document does not state these targets and a reviewer without v1 context cannot know they were ever established.
